channel.title: Whitelist- Poll reset: you need to vote again!
channel.description: After a recent incident involving some users posting the IP on /b/, I believe a whitelist should be implemented. We where lucky threads on /b/ last for about 5 seconds. I wouldn't have much of a problem if the server went on /v/, but /b/ is to much. I'll let you guys discuss. Vote away!

item.title: Whitelist- Poll reset: you need to vote again!
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Jammydee:

I think it’s a good idea, but if it’s automated then as david says, it’s pointless… It doesn’t take long to just sign up for an account on moparscape and just use that… and anyone can do it…

I think this is all we need to be able to do.

Read full topic
item.source: Whitelist- Poll reset: you need to vote again!

item.title: Whitelist- Poll reset: you need to vote again!
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:7, topic:387201”]So who exactly is going to take the time to constantly add names to the white list for moparscape members?

It’s a pain in the ass, and if we automate it, the functionality is gone anyway, right?[/quote]
But if someone keeps registering with the same ip and keeps getting banned from the server, couldnt MITB just ip them?

Or if they get banned from the server, make some kind of mysql connection or something that it ip bans them from mscp too after lets say 2-3 ip bans per ip?

Read full topic
item.source: Whitelist- Poll reset: you need to vote again!
